TODO - this is a comment: Can add notes here since JSON isn't great w comments...

Descriptions.allowGaps: if true, pieces don't have to fully cover the boardKey.
Descriptions.allowGroundLevelOverflow: if true, pieces can extend beyond the footprint of their boardKey, on the level closest to the boardKey.
Descriptions.allowSkyLevelOverflow: if true, pieces can extend beyond the footprint of their boardKey, above the level closest to the boardKey.
Descriptions.allowUpwardOverflow: if true, pieces can extend upward. This lets us reuse a simple 2D boardKey for 3D puzzles of any height, as long as they don't need a ceiling.
Descriptions.allowUnsupportedOverhangs: if true, overhangs over empty space are allowed.
Descriptions.allowSupportedOverhangs: if true, overhangs over other pieces are allowed.
Descriptions.allowSkyPieces: if true, pieces can be placed without any part touching the ground level.
Descriptions.colorByPiece: if true, each piece is assigned its own color. If a piece is added to supply multiple times, each gets its own color.
Descriptions.colorByOrientation: if true, each distinct piece orientation gives the piece its own color (up to 6 colors per piece. a cube would have 1 color).
Descriptions.allowColorVertexNeighbors: if true, same colors can meet at a vertex.
Descriptions.allowColorEdgeNeighbors: if true, same colors can meet at an edge.
Descriptions.allowColorFaceNeighbors: if true, same colors can meet on a face.
Descriptions.allowHiddenNeighborsToBreakColorRules: if true, color rules are not applied to pieces where the relevant meeting is buried/hidden in the solved state.
Descriptions.allow4PieceEdgeIntersections: if true, four pieces are allowed to meet at an intersection. Used in flat 2D puzzles.
Descriptions.allowPieceRotation: if true, pieces can be rotated in place (ie, keeping the same face down)
Descriptions.allowPieceOrienting: if true, pieces can be flipped to a different face (like rolling dice).
Descriptions.allowUnusedPieces: if true, the solution can omit entire pieces.
Descriptions.allowUnusedOrientations: if true, the solution can omit piece orientations. This allows for 2D puzzles.

Tiling_Default.name: Tiling Defaults
Tiling_Default.description: This is not a puzzle. This is a listing of the default settings for a tiling puzzle.

Clones_Tile_A_Square_Simple.name: Clones Tile A Rectangle - Simple Version
Clones_Tile_A_Square_Simple.description: Copies of a single polycube tile a rectangle boardKey. Simplest config; no constraint flags.

Clones_Tile_A_Square.name: Clones Tile A Rectangle - Restricted Neighbors
Clones_Tile_A_Square.description: Copies of a single polycube tile a rectangle boardKey. Matching orientations can't touch.

Overhang_City.name: Overhang City
Overhang_City.description: Copies of a polycube tile a rectangle boardKey and can overhang.

P_Pentominos.name: P-Pentominos
P_Pentominos.description: Use P-Pentominos to assemble a larger version of the same shape.

Locked_Triangles.name: Locked Triangles
Locked_Triangles.description: Pieces that can't turn. eg 36 Triangles Puzzle.
